paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene variant I84S in the context of ATTR amyloidosis, detailing its structural implications and clinical presentation.

patients.demographics: same kindred, specific ages not mentioned
patients.phenotype: ATTRv-I84S amyloidosis characterized by carpal tunnel, ocular deposition, polyneuropathy, and cardiomyopathy

individual_records.evidence_sentence: We collected cryo-EM images of cardiac fibrils extracted from the three ATTRv-I84S amyloidosis patients from the same kindred.
We collected cryo-EM images of cardiac fibrils extracted from the three ATTRv-I84S amyloidosis patients from the same kindred.
We collected cryo-EM images of cardiac fibrils extracted from the three ATTRv-I84S amyloidosis patients from the same kindred.

functional_data.summary: The study utilized cryo-EM to analyze the structural variations of cardiac fibrils from patients with the I84S mutation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the studied kindred.
variants.additional_notes: All patients were heterozygous for the ATTRv-I84S mutation.
key_quotes: ATTRv-I84S amyloidosis is characterized by a consistent clinical presentation that starts with carpal tunnel, ocular deposition, and polyneuropathy, and ends with cardiomyopathy that leads to death.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant I84S was extracted successfully.
